fast3d.complex.light

Interface Illuminatable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Renderable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdvTriangle, Group, Object, Scene

    public interface Illuminatable
extends Renderable
    a renderable is illuminatable if it has a surface that can be colored considering the universes lighting data
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Material getMaterial()
      may return null
      Vector3d getNormal()
      needed for some aligned lighting calculation like diffusive light or specular light may return null
      void invalidateLight()
      indicates that the previous (maybe cached) visible color has to be recalculated during the next render process
      void revalidateLight(Light... lights)
      called when the renderable has to recalculate the visible in here (for asynchronous calls)

      • Methods inherited from interface fast3d.Renderable

        getColor, getPos, getVertices, rayTrace, render, shade

    • Method Detail

      • getMaterial

        Material getMaterial()
        may return null
        Returns:
        all data needed to calculate the visible color of the surface

      • getNormal

        Vector3d getNormal()
        needed for some aligned lighting calculation like diffusive light or specular light may return null
        Returns:
        the vector outside-pointing and orthogonal to the surface

      • invalidateLight

        void invalidateLight()
        indicates that the previous (maybe cached) visible color has to be recalculated during the next render process

      • revalidateLight

        void revalidateLight(Light... lights)
        called when the renderable has to recalculate the visible in here (for asynchronous calls)
        Parameters:
        lights - all lights effecting the surface of the renderable
